item.title: Genshin Impact Version Luna V Release Date Unveiled for Later This Month
item.content:encoded:
HoYoverse has officially revealed the release date for Genshin Impact Version Luna V, and it'll bring a new five-star claymore wielder to add to your team, plus more, later this month.

Following on from January's Version Luna IV, Version Luna V, otherwise known by the long-winded title "Song of the Welkin Moon: Variation — Homeward, He Who Caught the Wind", will be released across all platforms on February 25th.

Its first major addition is the claymore-wielding 5-star Anemo character Varka, who's actually got two claymores; the first converts his damage based on his teammates' elemental alignments, while the second deals straightforward Anemo damage. He's a great addition if you're after some synergy without sacrificing power.

Somewhat unusually, Varka will be the only new character featured as part of Genshin Impact Version Luna V, but he'll be joined by a rerun of Flins in the first half of the update cycle, followed by reruns of Escoffier and Skirk in the second half.

With regards to new things to do, Genshin Impact Version Luna V will revolve around a "flagship event" in which you'll get to revisit some of your "cherished memories" of Mondstadt, as well as reconnecting with some familiar faces.

You can also look forward to new minigames and features including a brand new wave defense game, a photography minigame in which you'll take photos of iconic sights from around Genshin Impact's world, and updates to the Miliastra Wonderland user-generated content system.

This being a Genshin Impact update, there are also some codes to apply that will grant you some fun goodies. Here they are!

  • Homeward - 100 Primogems, 10 Mystic Enhancement Ore
  • VarkaArrives - 100 Primogems, 5 Hero's Wit
  • VisitWonderland - 100 Primogems, 50,000 Mora

Genshin Impact Version Luna V arrives on February 25th. The game is available to play for free right now on PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and mobile devices.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
